articles.author: Clare Jim
articles.description: Shares of China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) fell as much as 87% early on Monday when trading resumed following a 17 month suspension, wiping out almost $2.4 billion of its value, after saying it had "adequately" fulfilled all guidance issued by the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.
articles.title: China Evergrande loses $2.4 bln in value as trade resumes after 17 months

articles.author: Dan Levine, Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) is set to defend itself for the first time at trial against allegations that failure of its Autopilot driver assistant feature led to death, in what will likely be a major test of Chief Executive Elon Musk's assertions about the technology.
articles.title: Focus: Tesla braces for its first trial involving Autopilot fatality

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of Vietnamese electric-vehicle maker Vinfast surged 30% in premarket trading on Monday, extending a rally from last week that more than quadrupled its market value to $160 billion.
articles.title: Vinfast rallies on after becoming world's third-most valuable automaker

articles.author: Dhwani Pandya, Aditya Kalra
articles.description: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's plan to rehouse a million people living in one of Asia's biggest slums is fuelling worries among residents about his capacity to deliver amid high-profile financial setbacks and allegations that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's allies afforded him favourable treatment.
articles.title: Adani's bid to remake Mumbai slum spurs residents' doubts, favouritism claims

articles.author: M. Sriram
articles.description: Reliance Industries' retail unit is attracting "strong interest" from other top investors after raising $1 billion from Qatar Investment Authority, its billionaire chairman Mukesh Ambani said on Monday.
articles.title: Global investors show new interest in Reliance Retail, Ambani says

articles.author: Nevzat Devranoglu, Karin Strohecker
articles.description: Turkey's latest massive interest rate hike has caught the attention of long-sceptical foreign investors who say they could return to Turkish assets if authorities continue to demonstrate that a return to orthodox monetary policy is underway.
articles.title: Analysis: After Turkey's giant rate hike, foreign investors mull return

articles.author: Nichola Groom
articles.description: The U.S. Gulf Coast region, the nation's primary offshore source of oil and gas, has cheap electricity and lacks state mandates for renewable energy procurement, making it an unlikely place to expand one of the most expensive forms of clean energy.
articles.title: First US Gulf offshore wind auction to fuel region's green hydrogen push

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine said on Monday its troops had liberated the southeastern settlement of Robotyne and were trying to push further south in their counteroffensive against Russian forces.
articles.title: Ukraine says it liberates strategic southeastern settlement

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: A federal judge on Monday is expected to set a start date for former U.S. President Donald Trump's criminal trial on charges of trying to overturn his 2020 election defeat in a failed bid to keep himself in power.
articles.title: US judge to set trial date for Trump over efforts to overturn 2020 election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain's National Air Traffic Service (NATS) was forced to restrict the flow of aircraft on Monday as it works to address a technical issue, it said.
articles.title: UK air traffic control experiencing 'technical issue'
